# PLAN YOUR VISIT

### About CMCA

Experience the art of this generation and the next. CMCA’s exhibitions and educational programs are made to inspire and attract visitors of all ages and backgrounds.

CMCA’s striking building, designed by architect [Toshiko Mori](http://www.tmarch.com/), provides exceptional exhibition space for the presentation of work by contemporary artists connected to Maine. The CMCA Shop features a range of books, gifts and objects by primarily Maine artisans and designers.

Located in the heart of Rockland’s downtown arts district, CMCA is in walking distance of the [Farnsworth Art Museum](http://www.farnsworthmuseum.org/) and Wyeth Center, the [Strand Theatre](http://www.rocklandstrand.com/), and dozens of art galleries, restaurants, and hotels.

# membersHip

### look forward

### Support the art of this generation... and the next

Members provide essential and sustaining support for CMCA’s exhibitions and educational programs. If you’re interested in our highest membership levels, consider joining our [Contemporary Circle](https://cmcanow.org/support/contemporary-circle/). If you’re a business, take a look at our [Business Supporter](https://cmcanow.org/support/business) options.

#### All memberships include the following benefits:

  * Unlimited free admission to 8 or more unique exhibitions a year

  * Free admission to more than 15 Sunday Salons, Tuesday Talks, and gallery events

  * Subscription to CMCA eNews

  * Discounts on ArtLab classes, camps, and workshops

  * Discounts on event tickets

  * 10% discount in the CMCA Shop

  * Your membership is tax deductible

### MEMBERSHIP LEVELS
